subject: p15192710
History: History of graft-versus-host disease, status post allogenic transplant with cough x 3 weeks.
Findings: There are faint bibasilar opacities with possible bronchial wall thickening which are nonspecific but similar to that seen on. These findings are in the same distribution as seen previously on. Otherwise, cardiac silhouette is within normal limits. The aorta is unremarkable. Osseous structures demonstrate degenerative changes of bilateral glenohumeral joints.
Impression: Bibasilar faint opacities and bronchial wall thickening. These findings are nonspecific and may be seen with bronchiectasis, an infectious process, or bronchiolitis obliterans as previously noted. Further evaluation may be obtained with CT if necessary. These findings were discussed by Dr. With Dr. Telephone at 2:02 pm. On .
